required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation Of Quantitative Flow Ratio (QFR) - Derived Virtual Angioplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Validation Of Quantitative Flow Ratio (QFR) - Derived Virtual Angioplasty

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective intervention study to assess the accuracy of the predicted QFR-derived virtual angioplasty compared to hyperaemic and non-hyperaemic pressure-wire derived indexes after PCI, as well as with QFR post-PCI.

primary_outcome.measure: Numerical agreement between predicted post PCI QFR (residual QFR) and post PCI dPR RFR-FFR, as well as direct QFR post-PCI mesurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of the receiver-operator characteristics curve (sROC)
Identification of independent predictors for increased predicted postPCI QFR (residual QFR) and post PCI dPR-RFR-FFR.

arm_group.description: Patients submitted to a coronary angiogram with at least one non-left main stable coronary stenosis between 50 and 90% and PCI indication with paired assessment of QFR, dFR, RFR and FFR, before and after PCI once informed consent is provided.

intervention.description: Quantitative flow ratio (QFR) is a novel approach enabling rapid computation of FFR pullbacks from three-dimensional quantitative coronary angiography (3D-QCA) without using a pressure wire.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients submitted to a coronary angiogram with at least one non-left main stable coronary stenosis with PCI indication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe stenosis of the left main coronary artery.
- Patients admitted with ST-elevation myocardial infarction.
- Culprit lesions in Non-ST-Elevation Acute Coronary Syndromes (NSTEACS) patients.
- Unability to identify the culprit lesion in NSTE-ACS patients.
